nodes.name: On form submission

parameters.formTitle: Batch File Upload to Google Drive
parameters.formDescription: Use this form to upload multiple files to a specific Google Drive folder. Simply select your files and specify your target folder name. If the folder doesn't exist yet, we'll create it automatically for you. This streamlined process allows you to organize and store multiple files in one go, saving you time and effort.

nodes.name: Sticky Note

parameters.content:
# üóÇÔ∏è Bulk File Upload to Google Drive with Folder Management

## Overview
This workflow processes a form submission that accepts:
- Multiple file uploads (any format)
- Target folder name input

The workflow automatically:
- Checks if the specified folder exists in Google Drive
- Creates the folder if it doesn't exist
- Uploads all files to the correct folder
- Maintains original file names and structure

Perfect for batch uploading files while keeping your Drive organized!

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note1

parameters.content:
## üîÑ Decision Point: Folder Check
The workflow splits into two paths based on folder existence:
- ‚úÖ TRUE: Use existing folder path
- üÜï FALSE: Create new folder path

## üóÇÔ∏è Existing Folder Path (Upper)
1. Prepare Files for Upload: Splits files for individual processing
2. Upload Files: Uploads to existing folder maintaining structure

## üìÅ New Folder Path (Lower)
1. Create Folder: Generates new folder in Drive
2. Prepare Files for New Folder: Splits files for individual processing
3. Upload to New Folder: Uploads to newly created folder

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note2

parameters.content:
## ‚öôÔ∏è File Processing Notes
- All binary files are split individually for proper upload handling
- Original file names and structure are preserved
- Both paths ensure identical file organization

also see {{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note4

parameters.content:
## üîç Search Query Pattern

The following search pattern looks for a folder with the specified name in a particular parent folder:
Make sure to replace <folderId>

```javascript
mimeType='application/vnd.google-apps.folder' and name = '{{ $json.folderName }}' and '<folderId>' in parents
```

**Important**: Marl Always Output Data so you can check also if nothing found.

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# Formtrigger Workflow

## Overview
Automated workflow: Formtrigger Workflow. This workflow integrates 7 different services: stickyNote, formTrigger, code, googleDrive, set. It contains 17 nodes and follows best practices for error handling and security.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 17
- **Node Types**: 7
- **Error Handling**: ‚úÖ Implemented
- **Security**: ‚úÖ Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: ‚úÖ Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **On form submission**: formTrigger
- **Get Folder Name**: set
- **Search specific folder**: googleDrive
- **Folder found ?**: if
- **Create Folder**: googleDrive
- **Upload Files**: googleDrive
- **Prepare Files for Upload**: code
- **Prepare Files for New Folder**: code
- **Upload to New Folder**: googleDrive
- **Sticky Note**: stickyNote
- ... and 7 more nodes

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible
